intro: Escobaria missouriensis var. marstonii, commonly known as the Missouri nightshade, is a succulent plant native to the central United States. It is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit and bluish-gray foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy species suitable for xeriscaping. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and attractive addition to arid or semi-arid gardens.
